title: Industrial & Systems Engrg Principles & Practice II
description:
This module introduces the principles and practice of
engineering economics and financial decision making
faced by engineers. Students will learn how to deal
with the financial and economic aspects in the design,
evaluation and management of engineering systems
involving capital investments and cash flows over time.
Topics covered include principles and practices of cash
flow analysis, decision making involving single and
multiple alternatives, depreciation of capital assets and
after-tax project cash-flow analysis, replacement
analysis of capital assets, and dealing with risk &
uncertainty. Case studies and computational tools will
be used to model, analyse and solve complex problems
effectively.
